Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Reverend Dan Rodriguez, Senior Pastor at Greater Allen AME Cathedral, 110-31 Floyd H. Flake Boulevard Jamaica, New York 11433.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Miller.

The Invocation was delivered by Reverend Dan Rodriguez, Senior Pastor at Greater Allen AME Cathedral,
110-31 Floyd H. Flake Boulevard, Jamaica, New York 11433.

Council Member Miller moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Riley moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of December 17, 2020 and the Charter Meeting of January 6, 2021 be adopted as printed.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling on Congress to pass, and the President to sign, legislation amending the Stafford Act to proactively fund the planning and construction of FEMA and HUD coastal resiliency projects.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Resiliency and Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Amending the Stafford Act to proactively fund the planning and construction of FEMA and HUD coastal resiliency projects.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to remove the name “Robert Moses” from various state parks, roadways and bridges in recognition of the racism that motivated specific characteristics of those venues and discouraged lower income New Yorkers, specifically people of color, from easily accessing them.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Remove the name “Robert Moses” from various state parks, roadways and bridges.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Governor and the Chief Judge of the State of New York to implement appropriate COVID-19 safety protocols and improve the efficiency of criminal trials.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Governor and the Chief Judge of the State of New York to implement appropriate COVID-19 safety protocols and improve the efficiency of criminal trials.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to early voting
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Early voting.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation the provision of financial grants to small businesses and non-profit organizations to be used for cleaning expenses
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Provision of financial grants to small businesses and non-profit organizations to be used for cleaning expenses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation allowing local health departments to implement changes to improve the COVID-19 vaccine roll out.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Allowing local health departments to implement changes to improve the COVID-19 vaccine roll out.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting dwelling occupants to postpone indoor allergen hazard inspections until after the COVID-19 state of emergency, and providing for the repeal of such provision upon the expiration thereof
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Permitting dwelling occupants to postpone indoor allergen hazard inspections until after the COVID-19 state of emergency, and providing for the repeal of such provision upon the expiration thereof.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOT to develop a map of current bicycle infrastructure conditions.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo).

There were 47 Council Members marked present at this virtual Stated Meeting.

At the time of this virtual Stated Meeting, there were four vacant seats in the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winners of the following special non-partisan elections: February 2, 2021 in the 24th District (Queens); February 23, 2021 in the 31st District (Queens); March 23, 2021 in the 11th and 15th Districts (The Bronx).
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) adjourned these proceedings.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 1116-B,  34-13-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Cabrera, Cornegy, Deutsch, R. Diaz, Gjonaj, Grodenchik, Holden, Maisel, Ulrich, Vallone, Yeger, and  the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

Int. No. 1994-A,  46-1-0 - Negative: The Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo).

Int. No. 2166-B,  39-8-0 - Negative: CMs Barron, Cabrera, R. Diaz, Lander, Menchaca, Reynoso, Van Bramer, and Yeger.

Int. No. 2204-A,  42-4-1 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Holden, Vallone, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo);  Abstain: CM Miller.









See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
